properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 5 at 7:53AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW LIKELY IN THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF
SOUTHEAST WYOMING THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...

...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WEST OF
LARAMIE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH HEAVY SNOW LIKELY
SPREADING INTO THE INTERSTATE 25 CORRIDOR...

* WHAT...Heavy mountain snow and blowing snow. Total snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 feet, with locally higher amounts
possible on northwest facing slopes. Wind gusts up to 50 MPH.

* WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre Mountain Ranges.

* WHEN...Midnight tonight until 5 AM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Mountain travel will be extremely dangerous or
impossible due to icy, snow covered roads and near zero
visibilities at times in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor
recreation will be life threatening to those not prepared for
severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can easily
become disoriented and become lost. Frostbite and hypothermia
can set in quickly and result in death.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY
